---
date: '2025-07-12'
modified_time: 2025-07-12 19:26:57-04:00
published_time: 2025-07-12 19:24:45-04:00
source_url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/07/president-trump-first-lady-see-unbreakable-spirit-in-texas/
tags: articles
title: President Trump, First Lady See Unbreakable Spirit in Texas
---
 
Yesterday, President Donald J. Trump and First Lady Melania Trump
traveled to Kerr County, Texas, in the aftermath of last weekend’s
catastrophic floods. The President and First Lady surveyed the
devastation, met with community members and [local
officials](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943735552181776711),
[thanked](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943735552181776711)
[heroic](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943739691670323373)
[first
responders](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943739980670464153),
and pledged the Administration’s ongoing support as the community
recovers.

**President Trump delivered remarks during a roundtable discussion with
first responders and local, state, and federal officials:**

-   “As a nation, we mourn for every single life that was swept away in
    the flood and we pray for the families that were left behind. It’s
    amazing — the incredible spirit from those families. I don’t even
    know how they do it.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943761609114935592)
-   “The people here — first responders, the sheriff’s office, all of
    police, law enforcement — they’ve done an unbelievable job.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943760942073819426)
-   “We just were making a little tour of the area. It’s hard to believe
    the devastation — trees that were 100 years old just ripped out of
    the ground. I’ve never seen anything like this … We just visited
    with incredible families. They’ve been devastated.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943760796334391322)
-   “A lot of young angels at the girls’ Christian summer camp known as
    Camp Mystic … They were there because they loved God — and as we
    grieve this unthinkable tragedy, we take comfort in the knowledge
    that God has welcomed those little beautiful girls into his
    comforting arms in heaven.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943762101903688131)
-   “My Administration is doing everything in its power to help Texas …
    We’ve deployed over 400 first responders and assisted or enabled
    more than 1,500 rescues … Customs and Border Protection and the U.S.
    Coast Guard have deployed numerous search and rescue crews.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943763513496789125)
-   “Two words: unity and competence, if you were to ask me two words
    that I’ve seen here … The way everyone has just pulled together.
    It’s rare that you see this.”
    [*Watch*](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943769644151488944)

**Officials and members of the community praised the Trump
Administration’s response:**

-   [Gov. Greg
    Abbott](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943765422408335465):
    “We cannot thank you enough for deploying the Coast Guard, deploying
    the resources … When I made a request for a disaster declaration,
    you and your Administration granted that. This is the fastest that
    I’m aware of — of any Administration responding.”
-   [Lieutenant Governor Dan
    Patrick](https://www.youtube.com/live/PRuMlPjiKQg?si=JXSzQXFjKUlweoxS&t=1632):
    “You and Madam First Lady — the two of you being here sends a
    message. It paints a picture that words can’t express, and it gives
    them hope … You and the federal government will help us get through
    everything — all the debris that has to be taken, all the rebuilding
    — and I know we can count on you. So, from the bottom of my heart,
    on behalf of all of these families, thank you.”
-   [Texas Division of Emergency Management Chief W. Nim
    Kidd](https://www.youtube.com/live/PRuMlPjiKQg?si=_O5nuJHHLCcSPaLI&t=1312):
    “Your immediate declaration for individual assistance and public
    assistance will help us rebuild and recover … 19 other states have
    sent resources to us. Secretary Noem, thank you for the coordination
    and the effort on that. Your team has been phenomenal … Thank you
    for really great job you’ve done — and the coordination has been
    incredible.”
-   [Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi
    Noem](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943766247629263326):
    “What we are doing here, sir, is empowering the state and the local
    officials to make the best decisions for their people — because they
    know their people, they know their community… Thank you for being a
    President who trusts people.”
-   [Rep. Chip
    Roy](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943769326898586044): “I
    can’t thank you enough. When I called you on Friday, you said,
    ‘whatever you need’ … I’ve never seen such a quick response and such
    a focus on delivering for the people.”
-   [Texas State
    Trooper](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943774212667113594):
    “I want to thank you, too, sir — because if we didn’t have a secure
    border, we wouldn’t have this many assets to move. I wanted to say
    that to you personally.”
-   [Local
    resident](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1943735427308863856):
    “This is devastating. It’s horrible, but our President is here. He’s
    supporting us. He’s sending whatever support he can for us.”
